headline.main: SCIENCE NOTES: PERISCOPE

results.snippet: The Mercury capsule in which Navy Commander Alan Shepard made the successful sub-orbital flight through the threshold of space was equipped with a unique periscope system that enabled the astronaut to view the earth below him, and to use what he saw...
results.lead_paragraph: The Mercury capsule in which Navy Commander Alan Shepard made the successful sub-orbital flight through the threshold of space was equipped with a unique periscope system that enabled the astronaut to view the earth below him, and to use what he saw to make measurements of his altitude, direction, and position in space.

headline.main: Shepard's Ride

keywords.name: subject

results.snippet: The drama-laden race into space began Oct. 4, 1957, with a Russian victory: Sputnik I. During the next three years Russia maintained the lead, shooting up huge payloads, hitting the moon, photographing its far side, blazing a path to Venus.
results.lead_paragraph: The drama-laden race into space began Oct. 4, 1957, with a Russian victory: Sputnik I. During the next three years Russia maintained the lead, shooting up huge payloads, hitting the moon, photographing its far side, blazing a path to Venus.

headline.main: 'What a Beautiful View!'

results.snippet: Comdr. Alan B. Shepard Jr., seeing the world Friday morning from an elevation of 115 miles, broke into his technical ground communication messages to cry out, "What a beautiful view!" The words expressed pure elation. This was man escaping for a few...
results.lead_paragraph: Comdr. Alan B. Shepard Jr., seeing the world Friday morning from an elevation of 115 miles, broke into his technical ground communication messages to cry out, "What a beautiful view!" The words expressed pure elation. This was man escaping for a few minutes from the bounds and controls of earth. It did not matter at that time that another astronaut had recently gone higher and stayed up longer.

headline.main: In The Nation; The Great Senate Battle Over a Word

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 18 -- The Senate has just demonstrated its versatility as well as its love of culture by turning two successive days from grappling with acute world and domestic problems to discover and ascend a hitherto undiscovered peak of...

byline.original: By ARTHUR KROCK

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 18 -- The Senate has just demonstrated its versatility as well as its love of culture by turning two successive days from grappling with acute world and domestic problems to discover and ascend a hitherto undiscovered peak of etymology. The leader of this expedition onto a height never before attained by any English lexicographer, his fair hair flying above his classic but determined features, was Albert Gore, Democrat, the junior Senator from Tennessee.
